identity.short_description: Formerly a wine estate reborn in 2018, Chateau de Tauzies is a charming domain on the heights of Gaillac in the Tarn, at the heart of the Gaillac vineyard, offering full privatisation for weddings of up to 200 guests with 56 sleeping on-site.

location.landscape_description: On the heights of Gaillac, overlooking the plain of Gaillac, situated between Gaillac, Cordes-sur-Ciel, and Albi, at the heart of the Gaillac vineyard

history.historical_narrative: The site has known continuous human occupation from the Neolithic period to the present day. Originally an agricultural domain, it bore the name 'Besinie' around 1828-1830 and belonged to Michel Barrau. When Augustin Louis Barrau, a Gaillac lawyer, acquired the property in 1851, he had a new residence built on a rectangular plan, inscribing his initials 'AB' on the doors. The principal buildings (chai, stables, agricultural shed, cowsheds, barn, dovecote, and housing) were constructed between 1851 and 1867, when his daughter married Philadelphe Thomas. Philadelphe Thomas was a physician, archaeologist, paleontologist, and mycology enthusiast who conducted archaeological research on the domain while managing the wine estate. After the death of Marie Barrau in 1899, the estate passed through numerous hands throughout the 20th century. Formerly a wine estate with up to 40 hectares of vines on 56 hectares, the Chateau was reborn in 2018 as an event venue and accommodation run by Nathalie Deschamps and Jacques Tranier.
notable_architectural_features: exposed wooden beams in Salle du Chai
gun slit dating from 17th century reused in dovecote
terrace arrangement honouring reception rooms opening south onto the park
history.renovation_history: Reborn in 2018 with a new vision to become an exceptional event venue, transformed from a wine estate into an event venue and accommodation

spaces.name: Salle du Chai
spaces.description: Superb stone building with exposed wooden beams, perfectly blending modern elegance with historic authenticity. Fully equipped with round tables, chairs, and essential amenities. The space is divisible to adapt to different event types.

spaces.name: Covered Terrace
notable_features: breathtaking views of the Chateau and surrounding vineyards
spaces.description: Adjacent to the reception hall, offering breathtaking views of the Chateau and the surrounding vineyards. Ideal for cocktail receptions, particularly when outdoor conditions make the gardens less accessible.

spaces.name: The Gardens
spaces.description: Spanning 2 hectares with green spaces, swimming pool, relaxation area, and walks through the vineyard. Ideal for photos and/or outdoor ceremonies. Ceremony setup is not provided by the Chateau's teams.

spaces.name: L'Annexe (The Annex / Settler's House)
spaces.description: Located in immediate proximity to the main hall. Dedicated space for event preparation and meals. Includes a preparation area, children's area, sanitary facilities, and a cozy dormitory with 10 beds. Perfect as a preparation space for hair and makeup, or as a dining area or play area for children.

accommodation.mandatory_accommodation_details: Rooms included in the package that are not used will not be refunded or compensated.
accommodation.preparation_rooms: L'Annexe serves as a preparation space for hair and makeup

buildings.name: Le Chateau
buildings.description: 15 elegantly decorated suites with all modern amenities: 7 Comfort double rooms and 8 quadruple suites (4 with terrace).

rooms.name: Chambre Confort
rooms.bed_configuration: 1 King bed (180x200) or 2 Single beds (90 cm) - fully modular

rooms.name: Junior Suite (Suite Superieure)
rooms.bed_configuration: 1 King bed (180x200) and a convertible sofa bed (2x90 cm)

rooms.name: Suite Familiale avec Terrasse
rooms.bed_configuration: 1 King bed (180x200) and a convertible sofa bed (2x90 cm)

buildings.name: L'Annexe (Settler's House)
buildings.description: Cozy dormitory with 10 beds, also includes preparation area, children's area, and sanitary facilities.

room_amenities_common: en-suite bathroom with walk-in Italian shower
kitchenette (fridge, microwave, dishware set, ceramic hob)
accommodation.breakfast_details: Gourmet breakfast boxes/trays available in-room or on the terrace

pricing.starting_price_description: Low season (November to April) full privatization of the estate including reception room, covered terrace, accommodations, and gardens.

seasonal_pricing.months: November, December, January, February, March, April

pricing.rental_period_description: Friday at 2:00 PM for setup and decoration, until Monday at 12:00 PM (2025 package)
price_includes: Accommodation for Saturday night (up to 56 beds)
Round tables, chairs, and essential amenities
Sound system, WiFi, screen, and projector

drinks.venue_wine_requirement: At least one of the estate's own wines must be featured on the menu, selected during a tasting session

amenities.pool_details: Outdoor pool set among the vineyards
amenities.gardens_description: 2-hectare park with green spaces, swimming pool, relaxation area under cedar trees, vineyard walks, and petanque

nearby_activities: visits to Cathedrale Sainte-Cecile in Albi

technical.furniture_details: Round tables, chairs, and essential amenities provided in the Salle du Chai
technical.climate_control: Underfloor heating/cooling system in the Salle du Chai for year-round comfort

accessibility.accessibility_details: The establishment is not accessible to persons with reduced mobility. However, there is 1 restroom adapted for guests with reduced mobility.

parking.parking_type: Private, free parking with EV charging station available

policies.setup_access_time: Friday at 2:00 PM for setup and decoration (2025 package)
